definitions.definition: a particular life, in religions that believe that we have many lives:
examples: He believes that he was a Roman warrior in a previous incarnation.

definitions.definition: a particular physical form or condition of something or someone that is changing or developing:
examples: This film is the latest incarnation of a fairy tale that dates back to the Middle Ages.

definitions.definition: an extreme example, in human form, of a particular characteristic or type of behaviour:
examples: He was the incarnation of evil (= was extremely evil).

definitions.definition: the appearance of a god as a human
